items.content:
Hi Alessio, 


Thanks for submitting a request for a full end-to-end live streaming consultation service from the MPO LIVE team.


As mentioned on MPO Livestream Support - FAQ for GBS and PMM, we require at least 2 week notice before the live event. Your request does not meet this requirement. While sometimes we can accommodate short notice requests, your request is a weekend support request during our busiest period of fashion month. We do not have available resources to accommodate your last minute request. Therefore we will not be able to provide end-to-end support in this case.


I might be able to provide you some very limited support, mainly guiding you here on steps you should take before your client's live stream. Please let me know if you are interested in such a guidance here. 


If so, could you please provide the following information: 

1) What is the client ad spending budget on CI to Live? 

2) What is their budget for this live stream campaign in total (including pre-live, mid-live and post-live campaigns)?
3) What time on 24 Feb will your client go live and for how long? 

4) What is your client plans for the live stream?

5) Have they gone live on TikTok before?

6) Will they hire production company to produce this live content? Is this vendor experienced in going live on TikTok?  
7) Have they run CI to LIVE campaign before?

8) Do they have an agency that has run CI to LIVE campaign before? 


Best regards, 

Itay Filiba

MPO LIVE

Hi Itay,


many thanks for your feedback. I have shared this internally with Laura Milani as the advertiser, Ferrari, is a player with a high potential and our support in this moment might be crucial for our collaboration.

In the meanwhile please find my answers:


  1. 5K CI to Live.
  2. 65K in total.
  3. Start Time: 9:30 CET - End Time 13:30 CET.
  4. Broadcasting their Fashion Live Show Event.
  5. Yes.
  6. Yes.
  7. No.
  8. No.


Many thanks for your support, Alessio

Thanks for your answers, Alessio. 

Here are the steps I would recommend you to take at this stage:


1) Allowlist CI to Live - To use Community Interaction to Live, you will need to allowlisted your client (it's still in Beta). Please add the client's details to the following list. Here: CI to LIVE - Allowlist Request tracker. More information about CI to Live here: [Commdoc] Community Interaction to LIVE (Beta)

Process time: 5 working days


2) TnS protection - to minimise the risk of TnS banning this live stream, it is recommended to apply for TnS protection. You have already applied for TnS Full protection. However, the minimum ad spend thresholds for this is $15,000, which your client does not meet. I'll reach our to the TnS team and try to get this protection for your client anyway. You will be informed on Lark.

Process time: 4-6 working days (starting from 18 Feb)


3) MI exemption - As you might know, all adverts are being reviewed by MI to meet the TikTok advertising policy. You've already applied for this protection. However, the minimum ad spend thresholds for this is $10,000, which your client does not meet. I'll reach our to the MI team and try to get this protection for your client anyway. You will be informed on Lark.

Process time: 5-7 working days (starting from 18 Feb)


4) OBS Access - the account has access for OBS LIVE(which means going live using professional streaming software) until 2024-03-12. This means they are ready, and you don't need to take any action on this. 



Once your client set up the CI to LIVE campaign, please send me their campaign ID for review (at least 72 hours before the live stream start time). I will check that everything is set up correctly. 


If you have any questions, please let me know. 


Best, 

Itay

Thanks for your valuable support Itay,


  1. The client has been added into the tracker file a couple of days ago.

  2. Would like to emphasize the high potential of this advertiser based on a mid/long term collaboration timeframe.

  3. Same as point 2.

  4. Many thanks for sharing.

Looking forward to hearing from you. Thanks, have a nice we, Alessio

Hi Itay, good morning. How are you?

I have received a notification about my TNS protection request for Ferrari which has been approved. Might I ask you (just in case I have missed that among the notifications on Lark) whether also the MI exemption has been approved on your side?

Many thanks in advance for your support, Alessio

Hi Alesslo, 

MI Exemption has not been approved yet. It's now under review by the MI risk assessment team (like every request they get from us). You will be notified on Lark once approved or rejected. 

Let me know if you have any other questions. 

Best, 

Itay

Hi Itay,


how are you today? Hope all good. Just reaching out to ask whether there is an update for the MI Exemption (for Ferrari). Is there any specific blocker I might support you or the team with? If you have maybe any visibility on the timing for us to get some feedback from the team it would help as approaching the live show event.

Many thanks for your patience. Thanks, Alessio

Hi Alessio, 


MI Exemption - Regular process time for MI Exemption is 5-7 working days. Due to the Chinese New Year Holiday, these might be longer. You will be notified on Lark automatically on the outcome of your MI Exemption request. 

I believe you will get an answer today or early tomorrow. 


CI to LIVE - Has your client/agency set up CI to LIVE campaign already? If you want me to review these campaigns and make sure they set up correctly, please send me their the campaign IDs for review by today.

OBS LIVE - I would recommend your client to check their TT account and make sure they can go live using professional streaming software. If there is a problem, we should know about it now, since I won't be online to support this live stream on Saturday. Attached is a PDF guide on how to go live on TT using professional streaming software. This PDF file can be shared with your client. 


Let me know if you have any questions. 


Best, 

Itay

content.file_name: Go LIVE on TikTok via Browser 2024 - Q1.pdf

items.content:
Hi Itay,

many thanks for your feedback.


MI Exemption: clear, thanks.


CI to LIVE: sure, here is the campaign ID they have set up on Ad Manager: 1791527657956354.


OBS LIVE: Thanks, I'll reach out and get back to you in case any further support is needed.


Many thanks, Alessio

Hi Alessio, 


Thank you for sending the campaign ID. I review this campaign and have a few remarks: 


  1. Your client set up CI to LIVE ad spend budget of 3,738.00 Euro targeting Italy. You mentioned before that this activation is of 10,000 Euro on CI to LIVE. Do you know what the reason your client reduced their budget on CI to LIVE is? 

  2. This campaign targets a balanced audience. On CI to LIVE we recommend keeping the targeting Broad or Fairly Broad due to its short flight time (in this 1h15min). I would recommend changing the targeting of this campaign.




Best,

Itay

Hi Itay,


thanks for your feedback. Apparently the client has decided to move some more budget to their post live event campaign. Thanks for your reco on point n.2. By the way the client says that they have tested their account for the live stream and did work well.

Many thanks, Alessio

Hi Itay,


good morning and happy monday! How are you? Just a qq in regards with Ferrari Live Fashion Show, despite the loop has been set up for 2 hours, it was live only for 1:20, for that reason we did not manage to spend the whole campaign budget. Do you know if there was a specific reason for that (so we can share with the client too).

Many thanks in advance, Alessio

Hi Alessio, 


Good morning. The client (and their production company) are responsible to start the live stream on their TikTok account and also to end it.


The client started their live stream at 08:51 and ended it at 09:53 (the account was live for 1h 1m 25s). The CI to LIVE campaign was set up to 2 hour duration, therefore was not spent entirely. 


I monitored some of this live stream yesterday, and everything was okay on our side. 


The feedback for the client should be that the live stream duration and the CI to LIVE campaign duration should be aligned in order to maximise the campaign performance. 


Best regards, 

Itay

Hi Itay,


thanks for your feedback, just for me to better understand how it works in this case. Is it correct then that the loop doesn't run independently from the live stream run by the client? Asking because I understood that the loop would work on TikTok autonomously from the client being connected or not.

Many thanks, best. Alessio

Hi Alessio, 

The loop is stream to TikTok by the client/production company as it was a live content. TikTok system does not have internal tool to loop content. 

When a live catwalk is over, the client's production company streams this content again and again as it was a live content. The TokTok system does not know it's a recorded content. 

Hope this is clearer now. 

Best, 

Itay

Hi Itay,


all clear now, many thanks. Best, Alessio

Hi Alessio, 

Here are the metrics for the client's live stream.


Live name: Ferrari FW 24-25 fashion show

Live start time: 2024-02-24 08:51:54

Live end time: 2024-02-24 09:53:19

Unique viewers: 57,771

Total views: 64,492

Top viewer count: 2,161

New followers: 419

Likes: 149,746

Comment count: 2,723

Share: 783

Gifts: 0


*These metrics are for the actual live streaming page on TikTok (not the 'For You' page), whether the viewer came from paid campaign or organically.


Thank you for using MPO end-to-end live streaming consultation service. Our support for this live stream has ended. If you have any questions regarding this live stream, please feel free to reopen this ticket and ask us .


We will be happy to support you again in future live stream. Please request our support here


Best regards, 

Itay, MPO LIVE
